snippet: LEAD: California moved closer to its first execution in nearly a quarter of a century today when a divided Federal appeals court upheld the death sentence of Robert Alton Harris, who was hours away from execution at San Quentin prison last April w...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: California moved closer to its first execution in nearly a quarter of a century today when a divided Federal appeals court upheld the death sentence of Robert Alton Harris, who was hours away from execution at San Quentin prison last April when his sentence was stayed.

headline.main: California Closer to Its First Execution Since 1967

byline.original: By JANE GROSS, Special to The New York Times
